definition: gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms

sentences.english: During inhalation , contraction of the intercostal muscles elevates the ribs.
sentences.chinese: 吸气时肋间肌收缩，提起肋骨。

sentences.english: You are breathing"high", using your rib rather than your abdominal muscles.
sentences.chinese: 因为您正在运用肋间肌，而非腹肌进行深呼吸。

sentences.english: Intercostal muscles involved are breathing difficulties, speech sound small and weak.
sentences.chinese: 肋间肌受累则呼吸困难，讲话声音小无力。

definition: serratus anterior muscle (upper sides of the chest)
diaphragm/also written 橫隔膜|横隔膜[heng2 ge2 mo2]
rectus abdominis muscle (aka abdominals or abs)
pectoralis major muscle (across the top of the chest)
trapezius muscle (of the upper back and neck)
articular capsule (of joint such as knee in anatomy)
pleural cavity (part of thorax containing lungs)
latissimus dorsi muscle (back of the chest)
